properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 9:32PM CST by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
The Flood Warning continues for the Tennessee River at Savannah.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Tennessee River at Savannah
* until further notice.
* At 8 PM Wednesday the stage was 370.4 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Maximum forecast stage of 373.0 feet on Monday January 6.
* Flood stage is 370.0 feet.
* At 373.0 feet...Coffee Landing Road is under 3 ft of water at some
places, and evacuation is very difficult. Chelsa Road in Crump is
flooded at Gattis Creek. Leaning Tree Road going to the Riverview
settlement is flooded at Hardin Slough. Low spots along Connie Beth
Lane and Horse Creek are flooded. Wayne Jerolds River Park boat
parking area is beginning to flood. Low spots on Emerald Lane are
flooding north of Clover Drive.
properties.instruction:
A followup Flood Statement will be issued Thursday.

For graphical river and flood information...please go to
www.weather.gov and click near Memphis on the map, then select Rivers
and Lakes.

Do not drive through flooded areas...turn around don't drown.

Stay tuned to your weather radio and your local news media for the
latest river information.
